instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used to detect the development of Coffee Leaf Rust (CLR) on a test bench coffee-crop in the cyber-physical data-collection system?
Output: To detect the development of Coffee Leaf Rust (CLR) on a test bench coffee-crop in the cyber-physical data-collection system,the researchers used visible spectrum and remote sensing spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to detect the development of Coffee Leaf Rust (CLR) on a test bench coffee-crop in the cyber-physical data-collection system?
Output: Remote Sensing (RS) and Wireless Sensor Networks (WSN) were integrated to collect reliable multi-type data from different field sensors, RGB and multi-spectral cameras to detect the development of Coffee Leaf Rust (CLR) on a test bench coffee-crop.

instruction: What metric was chosen to detect the development of Coffee Leaf Rust (CLR) on a test bench coffee-crop in the cyber-physical data-collection system and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to detect the development of Coffee Leaf Rust (CLR) on a test bench coffee-crop in the cyber-physical data-collection system is the size dataset containing sensors and camera data required for creating a CLR development stage model. This metric can go as far as creating a model based on the collected data for effectively diagnosing the CLR.

instruction: What machine learning models were trained using the dataset collected by the cyber-physical data-collection system for CLR diagnosis?
Output: No machine learning models were specifically mentioned in the provided information.

instruction: Can the spectral feature processing methods used in the research on CLR diagnosis be considered superior to traditional methods in terms of accuracy and efficiency?
Output: Yes, the spectral feature processing methods used in the research on CLR diagnosis can be considered superior to traditional methods in terms of accuracy and efficiency.
